column1: The Purple Pig////Came here as a rec from a friend. It's a very hip restaurant with tapas that are sharing size. I tried the bone marrow
column2: which was delicious and the cilantro went well with it. We also had the milk pork shoulder. That was good
column3: but the pork was a little salty for me and I wish there was more mashed potatoes! Pig ears were good
column4: can never go wrong with this as an appetizer. And lastly
column5: my favorite dish was the ricotta gnocchi. The noodles and the cheese were the perfect texture together and the tomato sauce was made so well. We scraped the rest of it with bread.
